bug.short_desc: handle dependency to polkitd so that systemd understands it

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: On every shutdown polkitd unregisters the unix session before NetworkManager is stopped:
polkitd[898]: Unregistered Authentication Agent for unix-session:1 (system bus name :1.40, object path /org/freedesktop/PolicyKit1/AuthenticationAgent, locale de_DE.utf8) (disconnected from bus)
After that NetworkManager starts complaining:
NetworkManager[982]: <warn> error requesting auth for org.freedesktop.NetworkManager.{something}: (0) Authorization check failed: GDBus.Error:org.freedesktop.DBus.Error.NoReply: Message did not receive a reply (timeout by message bus)
where {something} is one of these: settings.modify.hostname settings.modify.own settings.modify.system wifi.share.open wifi.share.protected network-control enable-disable-wimax enable-disable-wwan enable-disable-wifi sleep-wake enable-disable-network
Then it tries to start polkitd again:
dbus[829]: [system] Activating via systemd: service name='org.freedesktop.PolicyKit1' unit='polkit.service'
which is a bad idea since the system is shutting down. So it looks like some logic got wrong here.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): Fedora 22, systemd 219-14, NetworkManager 1:1.0.2-1, polkit 0.112-9
How reproducible: Every shutdown
This package has changed ownership in the Fedora Package Database. Reassigning to the new owner of this component.
Not present any more on Fedora 24.
